normalized: --the morning of the 6th day of the voyage.
--the morning of the 6th day of the voyage.
lieri and naomi hadn't appeared for breakfast.
they claimed that they were ill and had decided to rest up in their room.

name: bohgan
normalized: …well, i don't blame them…kukukuu….
i let out a scornful laugh as i ate breakfast alone.
i'd imagine their senses burst into flames over the seething, heavenly sensations they experience when their clothes rub against their skin from merely walking….
not only that, but their sweet voices would cry out without any respectability or shame the instant they were touched by someone.
still, rest was far away even if they were lying down.
when their skin rubbed against the sheets inside their beds as they rested, it would surely drive their bodies into a fervent, heated ecstasy….

name: bohgan
normalized: …it seems awfully unlikely…that those two would be doing any "resting" as they had claimed…kukukuu…
i revealed a sadistic smile.
and--!?

name: lutz
normalized: --captain!
my aide, lutz, came to my side in a fluster.

name: bohgan
normalized: i hope it's something with you being flustered like that…

name: lutz
normalized: yes sir!

name: bohgan
normalized: yes sir!
their movement appears to be highly disturbing
kukukuu, as expected.
there's noting really strange about that when their bodies are like they are.
it's likely they didn't know what was making them that way and i'd guess that they were trying to fight it somehow….
well….

name: lutz
normalized: what do we do, captain!?

name: lutz
normalized: sh, shouldn't we hurry up and arrest them so that we can use them as bargaining agreements!?

name: lutz
normalized: --captain!?

name: bohgan
normalized: calm yourself, lutz

name: bohgan
normalized: if we were to do something like that, it would only give lieri bishop and naomi evans what they're hoping for.
merely to give them an excuse

name: lutz
normalized: tr, true, but--!?
i held out my hand to halt whatever he was going to say.

name: bohgan
normalized: it's going to be trouble when they bring out the gun turtle

name: bohgan
normalized: but even if they are planning on taking over this warship, they have a long way to go

name: lutz
normalized: but, captain…!?

name: bohgan
normalized: you still don't get it!?
i spontaneously raised my voice like i was becoming irritated.

name: lutz
normalized: hah?

name: bohgan
normalized: even though we're arriving at earth, there's still another good two days until we dock at a station

name: lutz
normalized: …ahh!
lutz raised his voice a little like he had finally understood their dilemma.

name: bohgan
normalized: that's right.
whether they like it or not, night will come and their hypnotic state will take affect.

name: lutz
normalized: of course!
in a blink of an eye, lutz's deathly pale state of panic had rehabilitated with vitality.

name: bohgan
normalized: listen, if we try to do anything suspicious, they will put up a fight

name: bohgan
normalized: i want to avoid as much bloodshed as possible.
so you get that across to my subordinates.
understood?

name: lutz
normalized: yes sir!
loud and clear!

name: bohgan
normalized: …yeah
i took a swig and finished my wine in front of my now relieved aide's face.
but…
to tell the truth, although i had been successful in giving piece of mind to my aide, my gut feeling was telling me this wasn't over by a long shot…
trouble arose just after 1500 hours--
lieri and naomi was utilizing the gun turtle to launch strong measures and take charge of the ship.
i showed up on the bridge….
there, i made an announcement, "we just need to buy some time, but absolutely without resisting.
surrender is an option if the situation warrants it.

name: subordinate
normalized: ca, captain…do you really think that's a good idea!?
a senior officer looked at me with a worried expression on his face.

name: bohgan
normalized: don't lose your cool!
just listen to what i said and concentrate on stalling somehow.
victory will be ours when night falls!
i issued a manifesto to my dismayed subordinates and rallied them.
and then--!?

name: lutz
normalized: ca, captain!
again, in a flustered state, lutz rushed to my side.

name: bohgan
normalized: what is it now!?
a bad premonition hit me upon seeing lutz's pale face.

name: lutz
normalized: a transmission…we've just received a transmission!

name: bohgan
normalized: a, a transmission!?
from who?

name: lutz
normalized: from the armada of 4 battleships!
they are closing in at 17 degrees at a distance of 20,00 kilometers!

name: bohgan
normalized: wha, whaat!?
it won't be long before that small armada will communicate a halt of our course and disarmament.
my intuition kicked in and discerned lieri's scheme.
my heart skipped a beat as i came to fully understand what i had not been able to so far.

name: bohgan
normalized: those sly devils!
my purpose wasn't to bring them safely to earth!
those battleships weren't sent here by the new solar force; they were planning to intercept our course from the get go.
this was all planned in advance.
it was a matter of timing to bring out the gun turtle as a means of enforcement.
shiit!
from the beginning those women sensed there was some kind of secret on this warship and planned to intercept and seize it on its way to earth!
i felt terrified having just now finally realized lieri's true purpose.
but, it was already too late.
whether they attacked me from the inside or outside or prevented me from maneuvering, there was already no way they could be helped.

name: subordinate 1
normalized: captain, instructions!?

name: subordinate 2
normalized: wha, wha, what…what do we do!?

name: subordinate 3
normalized: i think we should go down fighting!

name: subordinate 4
normalized: ah…against 4 battleships!?
my subordinates were quickly descending into a panic as they began yelling at one another.

name: bohgan
normalized: hold on!
i got their attention in a loud voice.
the subordinates' unrestful shouting died down with my booming voice rattling the mood.
i paused for a moment to regain my thought.
our odds against four battleships are impossible.
no matter how we struggled, we would inevitably be captured.
resistance only invited needless bloodshed.
and it seemed overkill to subjugate lieri and company running riot through my ship.
that didn't matter anyway because we were no match for the gun turtle… we would only be fodder…
my thinking that had gotten me through many close calls had come this far, so there had to be an answer.
i couldn't retreat.
i couldn't win.
so…!?

name: bohgan
normalized: all right!
gentlemen, listen up.
i have a plan!
--10 minutes later.
the jasant had accepted disarmament and a stoppage of its engines.
one week had passed since then--
i had become a prisoner after being seized by the armada of new solar battleships and sent and detained, along with my subordinates, at the titan space station.
i was charged by--commander lieri bishop as well as for assaulting major naomi evans.
it was as a result of aphrodisiac-type drugs being detected on them.
of course, they ignored my insistence that "they love the stuff, don't they?
evidence was also brought forth claiming that it was my own actions that led to the freak accident that blew up the jasant when it had been seized…
and the crew that had died when it exploded-- i was charged for murder on each of their accounts, which included magnus, hans, olov, and ingvar.

name: naomi
normalized: hey!
are you listening to me, bohgan!?
i looked at naomi raising her voice at me.
and also beside me--
lieri folded her arms as she scowled at me.
now--lieri and naomi were in the midst of interrogating me.

name: naomi
normalized: that battleship…why in the hell did you blow it up for!?

name: naomi
normalized: and how were you administering aphrodisiacs to us!?

name: naomi
normalized: bohgan!
naomi exposed her anger and drew closer to me.
lieri continued glaring at me in silence like she was trying to see the faintest movement in my expression.

name: bohgan
normalized: there isn't much else to say

name: naomi
normalized: …what!?

name: bohgan
normalized: i assume you're already aware of the fact your bodies were restructured to be "driven mad"?
kukukuu….

name: naomi
normalized: youu!
naomi, succumbing to her resentment, roughly grabbed a hold of my neck.

name: bohgan
normalized: …houu.
you're a fast one….

name: bohgan
normalized: you ought to be "orgasm junkies" hooked on aphrodisiacs that make you orgasm by walking alone, but… you're taking uned, right?

name: naomi
normalized: uohh!

name: bohgan
normalized: guhohh!?
naomi's fist slammed into my face, hurling me dramatically to the floor.
my molars clattered together as a rusty iron-like taste began spreading throughout my mouth.

name: bohgan
normalized: guu…!?
jesus…i always heard the new solars stressed human rights, but i guess i heard wrong

name: naomi
normalized: youu!
naomi was about to unleash a kick at me.

name: lieri
normalized: naomi!
stop!
lieri gained control of naomi like that, soothing her agitation.

name: lieri
normalized: …you, have given us a better understanding of the dire situation, haven't you
lieri looked at me with an expression that seemed to be hiding a preparedness in the depths of her gorgeous eyes.

name: lieri
normalized: i do not mind killing if i have to for the sake of justice.
do remember that

name: lieri
normalized: …we'll be back
saying that, lieri, along with naomi, proceeded to leave the room.
i moved my mouth towards their retreating figures.

name: bohgan
normalized: business as always, commander bishop!
the two looked over their shoulders with dubious expressions.
i stood up in a swaying manner from the floor.

name: bohgan
normalized: this room is awful…empty and tasteless.
i can't read from just the faint light at night!
it's like i can't breathe!
i watched lieri steadily as i spoke.

name: bohgan
normalized: i want light and a tv

name: lieri
normalized: and as compensation?
lieri asked in a guttural, slow tone.
i answered after a short silence.

name: bohgan
normalized: you can login into the jasant computer using the password "irodemah"

name: bohgan
normalized: you'll be able to draw closer to that warship's secrets from the preserved copies
silence.
her glance pierced through me like was shooting me.

name: lieri
normalized: understood.
tell the jailer what you want

name: naomi
normalized: …hmph!
the two turned around and left behind my isolated cell at a quick pace.

name: bohgan
normalized: …fuu
i breathed a sigh and wiped away the blood from my mouth onto my sleeve.

name: bohgan
normalized: well well…i wonder what looks you'll come back with in about 2 or 3 hours…fufufuu…
they would certainly learn of the warship's secrets contained on the backup disks.
yes.
the preposterous videos and pictures of lieri and naomi completely immersed in and getting off and being smothered in a sea of cloudiness.
a fever involuntarily erupted between my legs when i imagined the looks on their faces when they saw them.

name: bohgan
normalized: …hey, anyone there!?
hey!
i called out to the jailer while tapping on the glass door.
it wasn't long before a recognizable face appeared on the other side of the door.

name: jailer
normalized: …what is it?
the lone jailer was--master sergeant miguel if i remembered correctly.

name: bohgan
normalized: ahh, sergeant.
pardon me.
i assume you heard from commander bishop?

name: miguel
normalized: yes, i heard.
is there something i can get you?

name: bohgan
normalized: ahh, thank you.
to be honest, i'd like some light and a tv

name: miguel
normalized: ok!
understood

name: bohgan
normalized: excuse me, but could i have it now.
i'd also like a blue-filmed light installed
the sergeant knitted his eyebrows at that.

name: miguel
normalized: …blue-filmed?

name: bohgan
normalized: ahh.
something from my youth; helps me sleep.
i don't sleep well when i don't have that

name: miguel
normalized: haa….
but, you said you wanted it now….
i was pressed for an answer by the young, bewildered sergeant.

name: bohgan
normalized: sergeant.
this evening commander bishop is expected to return.
what was it the commander ordered you to do?

name: miguel
normalized: y, yes…a tv and a light and any other furniture you wished for….

name: bohgan
normalized: that's correct.
when commander bishop returns here tonight, what do you think the commander will think if you haven't done your job?
hmm?
as he heard me out, sergeant miguel nodded repeatedly in a a state of confusion.

name: miguel
normalized: un, understood…i'll arrange for it then…

name: bohgan
normalized: yeah.
i beg of you.
especially the light.
you mustn't forget the blue-filmed light!
i can't stand it being dark!
as miguel left the room, another jailer took his place on guard duty.
kukukuu…
and i heard someone chuckling in there.
looking that way, i saw that it was the substitute guard.
he was burly enough to be muscular, but was still very young….
he had a derisive smile, like scorn, as he gazed with a smirk towards the senior neo terror officer who was apparently afraid of the dark.
i returned a sweet smile his way.

name: bohgan
normalized: hey, how are you private?
for the moment, my best regards
